intro: Astragalus cyclophyllos f. nanus, commonly known as the dwarf cyclophyllos milkvetch, is a small perennial herb native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in steppe and desert environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
